p: Only a few studies of the effects of grain-based supplementation on technological meat quality parameters have been carried out in cervids. Among studies of the effects of different diets on the physical attributes (pH, color, and shear force) of deer meat, Volpelli et al. [ 10] found no significant effects of different dietary treatments, whereas others observed significantly lower pH values and more tender meat in deer supplemented with concentrates compared with animals grazing on pasture [ 9, 17, 19].
